questions.question: What is the primary mechanism of action of ciclosporin?
options: Inhibition of T-cell activation by blocking calcineurin
Inhibition of DNA synthesis in rapidly dividing cells
questions.answer: Inhibition of T-cell activation by blocking calcineurin

questions.question: Which intracellular protein does ciclosporin bind to in order to exert its immunosuppressive effects?
What is the primary effect of ciclosporin on T-cells?
options: Inhibits T-cell activation and IL-2 production
Enhances antigen presentation by dendritic cells
questions.answer: Inhibits T-cell activation and IL-2 production

questions.question: Which of the following cytokines is most directly affected by ciclosporin?
What is the role of calcineurin in T-cell activation?
options: It promotes the transcription of IL-2 and other cytokines
It inhibits the nuclear factor of activated T-cells (NFAT)
It enhances antigen presentation by dendritic cells
It increases the production of cytotoxic T-cells
questions.answer: It promotes the transcription of IL-2 and other cytokines

questions.question: Which of the following is a common clinical use of ciclosporin in veterinary medicine?
options: Management of immune-mediated diseases (e.g., atopic dermatitis)
questions.answer: Management of immune-mediated diseases (e.g., atopic dermatitis)

questions.question: What is the primary molecular target of ciclosporin in the calcineurin pathway?
Which of the following is a potential side effect of ciclosporin therapy?
How does ciclosporin affect the nuclear factor of activated T-cells (NFAT)?
options: It promotes the translocation of NFAT to the nucleus
It inhibits the dephosphorylation and activation of NFAT
It enhances the binding of NFAT to DNA
It increases the production of NFAT
questions.answer: It inhibits the dephosphorylation and activation of NFAT
